paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the effects of various mutations in the KCNH2 gene on the inhibition of the hERG channel by the compound Cavalli-2. Several mutations are analyzed for their impact on drug binding and channel function.

functional_data.summary: The S620T mutation largely abolishes hERG inactivation, significantly affecting Cavalli-2 action.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation is associated with a significant reduction in drug block.
key_quotes: The S620T largely abolishes IhERG inactivation.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation shifts the voltage dependence of inactivation gating, affecting Cavalli-2 action.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation results in a significant reduction in drug block.
key_quotes: The N588K mutation produces a +60- to +90-mV shift in voltage dependence of inactivation gating.

functional_data.summary: The Y652A mutation significantly reduces the inhibitory effect of Cavalli-2.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation eliminates voltage dependence of inhibition.
key_quotes: Although this concentration produced a profound inhibition of the WT channel, it had only a modest inhibitory effect on Y652A IhERG.

functional_data.summary: The F656A mutation profoundly affects the inhibitory action of Cavalli-2.

variants.additional_notes: The derived IC50 was 75-fold that of its WT control.
key_quotes: This mutation had a profound effect on the inhibitory action of Cavalli-2.

challenges: No individual-level penetrance data was provided in the paper.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focused on functional assays and did not provide detailed patient or penetrance data.
